revised_title: Awards and Achievements in Science: Royal Society Anniversary Address 1977
tldr: In this address, Lord Todd highlights the achievements and contributions of various scientists in different fields of science. The recipients of the awards include Dr. F. Sanger for his work on protein and nucleic acid structures, Professor P. Hirsch for his contributions to materials science, Dr. H. E. Huxley for his research on muscle structure, Dr. J. B. Adams for his work on nuclear particle accelerators, and several others. Their discoveries have significantly impacted various scientific fields and have led to a better understanding of the natural world.
